jurisdiction.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Joliet Illinois

21A914588F894F2CAE5E917E9CDCCC2B.description:
Predict what social problems will
become more pressing today and in the
future and how they relate to the
creation of all human beings and the
equal love God has for them.

8C282ADCA7F6482286FB680E696710FC.description:
Predict what social problems will
become more pressing in the future.

7303489F3C844ED3B04EFE609A5F0C97.description:
Describe how citizens and government
can cooperate or have cooperated to
solve an important social problem.

DC353B88DA5847C090286488047884B4.description:
Describe the contributions of
significant individuals and groups to
the common belief system of the United
States.

F79260CDF7FD4EC7A7FF17DD376F505B.description:
Assess the impact that commonly held
beliefs have had on social groups in the
United States over time.

A189BC00E77444B78C28EB5567D39421.description:
Understand how social systems form and develop over time. Understand how religious/Church social systems form and develop over time. Value the significance and impact of the Catholic Church throughout history. CSDS5 (K-6 CS)
Value history as a medium to assist in recognizing and rejecting contemporary cultural values that threaten human dignity and are contrary
to the Gospel message. CSDS5 (7-12 CS)
Value unique qualities and characteristics of different cultures in order to pursue peace and understanding, knowledge and truth. CSDS6
(7& 8)

C8D0D64D586A4660B330779BD8851856.description:
Outline the benefits of Catholic
Schools on society.

A534CB533A5348C9B512830F53F88547.description:
Analyze the roles that various public
and private institutions play as agents
of socialization (e.g., schools).

0789CA73C2E54CBA929438A17AD86D2E.description:
Identify how an individual may
influence institutional or group
behavior.

5C7E259C9CAB4CFF9CEAE8E60126668D.description:
Analyze the reasons why social
institutions change over time.

EE5991D50CD94A10B93D0AB71BCB271D.description:
Identify examples of how social,
political, and economic institutions
work together; give examples of how
religious institutions work together.

1144C7DFE6654142B000CA5945A576C6.description:
Define and describe what is studied
within the field of psychology.

FA5CF6DE346540EB997D549FC6497788.description:
Define and describe what is studied
within the field of sociology.

328E215DB95142E990D5029B34888816.description:
Understand the roles and interactions of individuals and groups in society. Understand the roles and interactions of individuals and groups in society and their role in the Church. Value the diversity among students in the classroom and school community as children of God. CSDS3
Analyze stories of important Catholic figures and saints who through their examples re-awaken that period’s moral sense. CSGS3 (7&8)
Discuss how religious and moral knowledge is a requisite for understanding the dram of human grandeur throughout history. CSGS4 (7&8
Value one’s own role and dignity in God’s plan and creation. CSGS5 (7&8)

926C7A2FAE6E4972B70A97BC04E9DCC9.description:
Analyze how the Catholic Church has
influenced literature, art, music, and
architecture.

1FF200A6F6C84C618A876D2F78AC4CDE.description:
Analyze examples of patterns within
literature, art, music, and/or
architecture being transmitted from
place to place.

3AFBFE05428C43A98DCA179123432BF0.description:
Explain how technology and the media
have impacted how culture is expressed
within society.

D5E3F011490D46AD8A0CBCB3EFF4966C.description:
Describe how a culture is reflected in
its art, music, and/or architecture and
institutions.

F1F6D701D8BF43BEBCC16DAA142BDFDF.description:
Describe what is studied within the
field of anthropology.

E70EE72924AC4CCB94300CF9EF86E1E1.description:
Compare characteristics of culture as reflected in language, literature, the arts, traditions, and institutions. Compare characteristics of religious culture as reflected in language, literature, the arts, traditions, and institutions.  Select and describe beautiful artifacts from different times and cultures. CSDS1
Value the cultural inheritance the Church provides us yesterday and today. CSGS3
Value the unique qualities and characteristics of different cultures in order to pursue peace and understanding, knowledge and truth. CSDS6
(7&8)

08708F3CADE147ADA039BCCFE0884F2F.description: Understand social systems, with an emphasis on the United States. Understand religious aspects of social systems with an emphasis on the United States
